Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: ID of the agent to despawn

Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: the agent to update

Info.Name: Position
Info.Description: the x/y-coordinates

Info.Name: Plane
Info.Description: plane the agent ist standing on

Info.Name: Data
Info.Description: attribute id, normal value, modified value

Info.Name: Position
Info.Description: the x/y-coordinates

Info.Name: GivenBy
Info.Description: The name of the NPC that gave the quest.

Info.Name: MapID
Info.Description: The Map ID where the quest was given.

Info.Name: QuestDescription
Info.Description: This is used to set the description and objectives of a quest (after the client requests it with P010) as seen in the quest log. These descriptions are made up of somewhat complex combinations of strings.

Info.Name: GivenBy
Info.Description: The name of the NPC that gave the quest.

Info.Name: MapID
Info.Description: The Map ID where the quest was given.

Info.Name: Skills
Info.Description: bit field containing the disabled skills

Info.Name: Position
Info.Description: the x/y-coordinates

Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: the agent to update

Info.Name: Leadhand
Info.Description: the item to equip in the leadhand

Info.Name: Offhand
Info.Description: the item to equip in the offhand

Info.Name: HeroUpdate
Info.Description: This is used to add a hero to the pull down menu in the party window.

Info.Name: Icon
Info.Description: the icon on the button

Info.Name: Caption
Info.Description: the caption of the button. maximum size is 128 wchars

Info.Name: ButtonID
Info.Description: client will send this ID to the server when the button is hit

Info.Name: SkillID
Info.Description: the skill displayed if skill icon is used else its value: 0xFFFFFFFF

Info.Name: Body
Info.Description: body or part of body of the next dialog displayed. contains html like syntax. maximum size of this field is 122 wchars.

Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: agent that "speaks" the dialog see remarks[1]

Info.Name: WindowItems
Info.Description: This can be used to add items to a window, such as at a material trader.

Info.Name: Position
Info.Description: the x/y-coordinates

Info.Name: Amount
Info.Description: The number of minions the agent is controlling

Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: the agent (NPC) to assign the new name to

Info.Name: Name
Info.Description: new name to assign to NPC

Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: The agent who is speaking.

Info.Name: Name
Info.Description: The name that will appear in the window.

Info.Name: Position
Info.Description: the x/y-coordinates

Info.Name: Professions
Info.Description: bit field containing the available professions

Info.Name: WindowSkills
Info.Description: This can be used to add skills to a window, such as at a skill trainer.

Info.Name: RankId
Info.Description: Id of the rank used to refernce it

Info.Name: Rank
Info.Description: the rank of the title

Info.Name: Name
Info.Description: Name of the rank

Info.Name: TitleTrackId
Info.Description: id of title track

Info.Name: TitleGroupId
Info.Description: 0 = no group

Info.Name: MaxRank
Info.Description: max rank as value

Info.Name: MaxRankId
Info.Description: id of max rank

Info.Name: PointName
Info.Description: Name of points in title

Info.Name: AgentAttributeDestroy
Info.Description: This is used to destroy an agent's attribute points specified with P044_UpdateAttribPts.

Info.Name: isPvP
Info.Description: Determines whether the leeching option will be enabled

Info.Name: ObjectGeneral
Info.Description: This is used to setup objects such as signposts.

Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: the object agent ID

Info.Name: GuildAllyAdd
Info.Description: This is used to add guilds to the alliance tab of the guild window. The guild must first be created with P278 (or P279 for the player's guild).

Info.Name: GuildWindow
Info.Description: This can be used to apply a guild created with "P279_GuildGeneral":https://github.com/GameRevision/GWLP-R/wiki/P279_GuildGeneral to the guild window.

Info.Name: MemberType
Info.Description: The member type specified here will determine whether the guild window will let you invite players/guests, edit the guild announcement, etc.

Info.Name: Date
Info.Description: The number of days since 12/31/1899

Info.Name: GuildAllyGeneral
Info.Description: This can be used to setup a guild to be displayed in the alliance tab of the guild window.

Info.Name: GuildGeneral
Info.Description: This can be used to display a guild in the guild window and/or apply a cape to player agent(s).

Info.Name: GuildHallData
Info.Description: this is sent to the server when trying to travel to the guildhall

Info.Name: GuildInvite
Info.Description: This can be used to display a guild invite, alliance invite, or guild guest in the guild window.

Info.Name: GuildPlayer
Info.Description: This is used to display players in the guild window. After a guild player has been created, you can send the packet again with the same primary name to update their info. (e.g set them offline)

Info.Name: PrimaryName
Info.Description: The player's primary name (the one they were invited with)

Info.Name: DisplayName
Info.Description: The player's name displayed in the guild window

Info.Name: ContextInfo
Info.Description: Information displayed in the context menu when you hover over the player (such as who promoted them)

Info.Name: LastLoggedOn
Info.Description: The number of minutes since the player was last online

Info.Name: LocalID
Info.Description: The local ID of the handbook item

Info.Name: PageID
Info.Description: new defined pageId used to refer to this inventory

Info.Name: Slots
Info.Description: number of slots in this new inventory

Info.Name: AssociatedItem
Info.Description: optional the id of the bag the inventory belongs to

Info.Name: ItemLocalID1
Info.Description: the moved item

Info.Name: ItemLocalID2
Info.Description: the item to be swapped with

Info.Name: ItemLocalID
Info.Description: the tome item

Info.Name: ItemGeneral
Info.Description: This Packet describes an item in general.

Info.Name: FileID
Info.Description: Can also be armor ID if the armor flag is set

Info.Name: ItemID
Info.Description: ID of the item

Info.Name: ChestID
Info.Description: ID of the chest object

Info.Name: Position
Info.Description: the x/y-coordinates

Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: hero agent

Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: hero agent

Info.Name: InformationChat
Info.Description: Will display text of hard coded string IDs in the chat box

Info.Name: InformationBox
Info.Description: Will display text of hard coded string IDs in an info box

Info.Name: ButtonID
Info.Description: ID of the button to press

Info.Name: AgentID
Info.Description: ID of agent to change (yourself or a hero)

Info.Name: Profession
Info.Description: ID of the profession to change to

Info.Name: SkillSlot
Info.Description: Slot of the skill you are changing (between 0 and 7)

Info.Name: SkillID
Info.Description: ID of the new skill

Info.Name: Unknown
Info.Description: Always 0 when called from Guild Wars, if sent as a non-zero value it seems the packet has no effect

Info.Name: SkillID1
Info.Description: ID of the skill you drag

Info.Name: Unknown1
Info.Description: is usually 0, but seems to be -1 or -2 if this skill appears more than once on the bar (e.g. by echo)

Info.Name: SkillID2
Info.Description: ID of the skill you dropped Skill1 on

Info.Name: Unknown2
Info.Description: same as above, usually 0
